KNOWLEDGE AND SUPPORT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AT A GLANCE

I.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SUBPROJECT 
 
A.  Overall Progress of the Technical Assistance Cluster 
 
1.  The knowledge and support KI 2021–2023 TA cluster was approved in November 2019, 
with an overall implementation from 1 September 2020 to 31 December 2024. Subproject 1 will 
be implemented from 1 September 2020 to 30 June 2022; Subproject 2, from 1 October 2021 to 
30 June 2023; and Subproject 3, from 1 October 2022 to 31 December 2024.  
 
B.  Subproject Outcome 
 
2.  The TA will have the following outcome: use of Key Indicators for Asia and the Pacific data 
and analysis for evidence-based policymaking by DMC officials and economic researchers 
sustained. Subproject 1 will support the outputs of the overall TA cluster, as it will support 
production of the Key Indicators for Asia and the Pacific 2021 (KI 2021); the KI 2021 Special 
Supplement;1 Basic statistics 2021; the updating of KI Database (KIDB), Portal for Statistics 
Resources (Statistics Portal), and AsiaData; and dissemination activities of the KI 2021 data.  
 
C.  Subproject Outputs, Methods, and Activities 
 
3.  Output 1: Key Indicators for Asia and the Pacific 2021 and Basic Statistics 2021 
finalized and published. The TA will support the production of KI 2021 that will entail compiling 
updated statistical tables and updating the KIDB on regional member countries through data 
collection activities from national and international statistical partners and ADB sources.2 The 
publication is intended to serve as a resource for information related to the development issues 
confronting ADB regional members. It presents a comprehensive set of economic, financial, social, 
environmental, and selected statistical indicators of the SDGs through its country tables, regional 
tables  in  eight  broad  themes  (people;  economy  and  output;  money,  finance,  and  prices; 
globalization; transport and communication; energy and electricity; environment; and government 
and governance), and the SDG tables by goal. It also covers global value chains (GVC) statistics, 
which show how the economies in Asia and the Pacific continue to strengthen, broaden, and 
diversify their participation in global production networks. KI 2021 will be disseminated digitally in 
coordination with ADB’s Department of Communications (DOC) via the ADB website and the new 
KIDB. Its impact will be monitored through the usual download metrics but adding more granularity 
as well as through new parameters that consider new ways of disseminating information, which 
will be discussed with DOC and/or the Office of Information Systems and Technology (OIST). As 
it is also intended as a reference for ADB Management and operations, dissemination of KI 2021 
will also cater to internal clients to create awareness on available statistical information on ADB 
developing member countries (DMCs). Moreover, while digital publication will be the main form 
of dissemination, a limited number of printed copies (around 400) will be produced for promotional 
or awareness-raising purposes and to meet requests of some specific groups for KI data as well 
as internal requests. This output is in line with output 1 of the TA cluster. 
 
 
1  There will be two special supplements for Key Indicators for Asia and the Pacific 2021 discussing emergent 
development issues in Asia and the Pacific. The first supplement is envisioned to be released in time with the launch 
of the Key Indicators main publication while the second will be released on a different date after the launch. 
2  The statistical partners referred to in the TA report are the Key Indicators data sources in ADB DMCs to which the 
Key Indicators questionnaires are sent. These are the government agencies in the DMCs that provide official 
statistics for the Key Indicators publication. They could be the ministry or department of finance, the central bank, 
the national statistical office, and other relevant government agencies.

2 
4.  The TA will also support the production of Basic Statistics 2021 (BS 2021). Basic Statistics 
presents current data for ADB DMCs on core and selected economic, environmental, and social 
indicators used globally to track progress toward the SDGs. It is intended to serve as a handy and 
comprehensive source of snapshot information on ADB’s DMCs. As in the past editions, BS 2021 
will be available digitally on the ADB website and will also be accessible using mobile technology. 
A limited number of printed copies (1,500 to 2,500) will be produced for internal use of ADB 
Management and staff and for consumption of the general public. Basic Statistics is also used by 
ADB for awareness-raising events, which help promote the profile of ADB as a knowledge center 
in Asia and the Pacific. 
 
5.  Output 2: Key Indicators for Asia and the Pacific 2021 special supplements finalized 
and published.3 The TA will support the preparation of two special supplements in 2021. The 
focus of the first will be on measuring the contribution of digitally-enabled productive activities to 
the total economy. This technical study will cover the development of statistical concepts and 
methods related to the measurement of digital economy and synthesize commissioned papers on 
the subject by economists and statisticians. The second supplement will study the state and 
evolution of global value chain participation by selected DMCs, and the economic effects of such 
participation, using multi-sourced data and cutting-edge analytical methods. The draft outlines 
and contents of the special supplements will be presented to ERCD and other departments for 
input and feedback. Output 2 is in line with output 2 of the TA cluster.  
 
6.  Output 3: Key Indicators for Asia and the Pacific, Portal for Statistics Resources, 
and AsiaData mobile application updated. With the release of the new user-friendly KIDB in 
September 2019, accessing information on ADB’s regional members is more convenient and 
interactive. The TA will support the continuous enhancement of the database to keep up with the 
demands of users and with changes in technology. KIDB will be updated based on statistics and 
data stories produced from KI 2021. It will be available on the ADB website through KI’s landing 
page or directly at https://kidb.adb.org/kidb/. This output supports output 3 of the TA cluster. 
 
7.  The TA will support the maintenance and regular updating of the Portal for Statistics 
Resources, also known as the Statistics Portal that is available internally within ADB.4 The portal 
offers a systematic structure for organizing and disseminating the in-house statistics resources in 
ADB, e.g., databases and micro-level survey data sets procured by ERCD and other departments 
in ADB. It provides data support and information regarding data availability and resources that 
are useful for research activities of ADB or for formulating policy recommendations. It provides 
information on how to access or procure statistics resources that are not available within ADB or 
that cannot be obtained through the internet.  
 
8.  Updating the AsiaData mobile application—a visualization tool for mobile devices that 
presents the latest macroeconomic and social indicators for ADB's regional members—will be 
supported by the TA. The application allows users free access to data and allows them to easily 
construct their own graphs and tables using any of the over 200 featured indicators for ADB 
regional members. Users can readily compare countries for one indicator or compare trends of 
one indicator for a country. Similar to ready-made graphs, user-defined graphs can be saved or 
shared, and corresponding data tables can also be shown. The application is available for Android 
and Apple operating systems. Upgrading the application will require information technology (IT) 
expertise. 
 
 
3  The topics will be cleared with ERCD management. 
4  https://statistics.adb.org/statresource/

3 
9.  Output 4: Workshops for knowledge sharing and dissemination conducted. KI 2021 
publication and data will be disseminated via web launch and/or launch events.5 It will include key 
results and data stories about Asia and the Pacific that are based on the data included in KI 2021. 
Knowledge-sharing activities will also be conducted for the special supplements, on KI as a data 
product to increase awareness about the publication and the KIDB, on the Statistics Portal, and 
on AsiaData. Output 4 of subproject 1 supports output 4 of the TA cluster. 
 
D.  Subproject Cost and Financing 
 
10.  The TA subproject is estimated to cost $800,000, which will be financed on a grant basis 
by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund ($400,000 under TASF 6 and $400,000 under TASF 
Others). The key expenditure items are listed in Appendix 2.  
 
E.  Subproject Implementation Arrangements 
 
11.  ADB will administer the TA through the Statistics and Data Innovation Unit of the Office of 
the Chief Economist and Director General (EROD-SDI). EROD-SDI will coordinate with other ADB 
units (regional and other departments, resident missions, and sector and thematic groups) and 
statistical partners in ADB regional members in undertaking the TA activities. Subproject 1 will be 
implemented  over  22  months—from  September  2020  to  June  2022.  EROD-SDI  will  be 
responsible for consultant recruitment and management and procurement of IT equipment that 
may be needed. ADB will administer the TA. For the launch events and dissemination workshops, 
the TA will provide for staff acting as resource persons in the workshops.

13.  Consulting services. The preparation of the statistical tables of KI 2021 will entail 
significant inputs from time-based national consultants selected via individual selection process. 
An estimated 176 person-months of national consultancy inputs would be required to prepare the 
statistical tables of KI 2021, update the indicators for BS 2021, work on updating the GVC 
statistics,  update  and  enhance  KIDB  and  the  Statistics  Portal,  and  prepare  the  graphics 
requirements of the final outputs. For updating of AsiaData mobile application, a firm will be 
engaged via quality-and cost-based selection method. An estimated 6 person-months of output-
based and time-based international consultancy inputs will be needed for writing the statistical 
commentaries  for  KI,  editing,  providing  IT-related  advice  and  support  for  KI,  and  writing 
commissioned papers for the topic on the special supplement. ADB will engage the consultants 
following the ADB Procurement Policy (2017, as amended from time to time) and its associated 
project administration instructions and/or staff instructions.6  
 
14.  ADB’s procurement. Statistical and other software, survey data sets, data subscriptions, 
and IT equipment will be procured under the TA as needed and in coordination with OIST for IT-
related procurement. Survey data sets, e.g., labor force survey data sets, will be procured 
depending on needs of research work in EROD-SDI and other divisions in ERCD subject to the 
item allocation in the TA’s cost estimates and financing plan. This will also include subscriptions 
to special databases that are used as source of information for special studies in ERCD. IT 
equipment will be procured based on needs determined during TA implementation. Procurement 
will follow the ADB Procurement Policy (2017, as amended from time to time) and the associated 
staff instructions.  
 
15.  Social media and websites. The contents of KI 2021 and related knowledge products 
will be prominently disseminated via the ADB website through the dedicated KI publication site,7 
KI landing page,8 and the KIDB as well as on social media in coordination with DOC. Since the 
KI landing page is part of the ADB website, its maintenance will be coordinated in collaboration 
with DOC. EROD-SDI will be responsible for the maintenance of the KIDB in collaboration with 
OIST and DOC. A news release of KI 2021 launch will be prepared and published on the ADB 
website. Dissemination of KI 2021 on ADB’s official social media channels will utilize infographics 
and data driven stories which will be coordinated with DOC.
